Description: Shoulder fragment of East Greek pottery closed vase, probably oenochoe; tongue frieze at top of shoulder; below, according to Venit, goat leaping to left, its head preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 7, no. 12 pl. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.709)
